alert.note: Alert for Bent; Crowley; Kiowa; Otero (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 05 at 9:15PM MDT until July 06 at 12:15AM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pueblo has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northern Bent County in southeastern Colorado... Crowley County in southeastern Colorado... Southwestern Kiowa County in southeastern Colorado... Northern Otero County in southeastern Colorado... * Until 1215 AM MDT. * At 915 PM MDT, Floodng was reported on highway 96 in Otero county. . Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... La Junta, North La Junta, Rocky Ford, Las Animas, Fowler, Ordway, Swink, Manzanola, Olney Springs, Sugar City, Cheraw, Crowley, Haswell, Arlington, Blue Lake, John Martin Reservoir, Hasty, McClave, Fort Lyon and Caddoa. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
